instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics problem
threads.message: [FONT=arial][SIZE=14px]Board had the GPU replaced about 2 years ago and worked fine till now, when it came in and it had the typical GPU issues so I replaced the GPU with the same [LEFT][COLOR=#011F36]216-0810084, this time the computer booted up but some areas of the image show lines and weird colors, I then put a new-other GPU and same issue, I also replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> but I am stil getting 1.3v on [/COLOR][/LEFT][COLOR=#0b0354]<SIGNAL>PP1V5_GPU_REG</SIGNAL>, any pointers will be appreciated.[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics problem
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is not a problem in this board.
And 1.35V is correct voltage for vRAM.

Same issue on external monitor?
Could be now bad solders/traces under vRAM chips.

Is almost impossible to get real "NEW" chip for these; better to disable GPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics problem
threads.message:
I just got about 4 of this Macs from people who don't have money to buy new computers and they want me to fix them even by disabling the GPU, so far I am successful doing this with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B by following this steps:
[LIST]
[*]Doing this will disable external image to a monitor 
[*]Adjusting brightness can only be done via software with an App called QuickShade and a version compatible with 10.13 or below, the current one in the App store wont work.
[/LIST]
[LIST=1]
[*]Set <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> (<RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>) to 3v with jumper from <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> (<RESISTOR>R5650</RESISTOR>), this solves problem when opening lid shows no image. 
[*]Remove <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> to remove power to GPU 
[*]Load modified BIOS to disable GPU 
[*]Select a startup disk 
[*]Add a firmware password “GPU” so an SMC reset won’t disable this "hack"
[/LIST]

Now on boards <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A those same steps wont work, any pointers will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics problem
threads.message: I know that there is the Tiresias (the GPUkiller)  that makes this easier, but I am trying to see if I can get away by doing it just with changing hardware configuration and changing BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> graphics problem
threads.message:
I never looked at A/B board version.
I did maybe 10 in this way.
Few months ago I started to do it reflashing GMUX.
